text:
In case anyone is looking, unlabeled types are listed in the docs
<https://developers.HubSpot.com/docs/api/crm/associations>

• *Primary:* the main company that the other record is associated with. Primary associations can be used in HubSpot tools such as <https://knowledge.HubSpot.com/crm-setup/associations-enhancements-beta#use-associations-in-HubSpot-tools|lists and workflows>. For example, set up a workflow to only take action on records that are considered the _Primary_ association. The first company record associated with a contact, deal, or ticket is automatically set to _Primary_. This API supports changing which company is considered the primary.
• *Unlabeled:* an association type added when any contact, company, deal, or ticket record is associated. This type denotes that an association exists, and will always returned in responses with a label value of `null`. When a record has a primary association or a custom association type, those types will be listed alongside the unlabeled association type.

<@U25PYL3Q8>
Hi!
Thanks for the reply.
I need the logos of all the companies that are placed in my customer's HubSpot to extract them via API. I can't find the appropriate property (like name, city, zip, etc)

Hi all, I am developing an OAuth integration for my client app and I am trying to use optional_scopes parameter for some of the scopes but I am getting "Insufficient scopes were provided. Please contact the app developer" error when I'm authorizing my app with my account. Without optional scopes, it works fine, I can authorize for all scopes. What can be the problem here, would appreciate your help!
If you are talking abotu companies that exist, and are associated with a contact, companies api is here: <https://developers.HubSpot.com/docs/api/crm/companies>

Hey <@U03TQT0MY6Q> if you have scopes selected in the developer account, those need to be in the `scopes` parameter since those are considered required. If you want to work with `optional_scopes` do not select them in the developer account. They should only appear in your authorization URL
<@UBT0AHWLD> Out of interest how would you find out how big your HubSpot database is to choose a plan?
i think i would choose the free plan, see how big the backup is and try to estimate based on that size

i think its unlikely that a single backup would exceed 1GB. Of course this would be exceeded by continous backups, but the question by how much, should probably be calculated based on the first backup

Question about the documentation around searching contacts via the API *`POST crm/v3/objects/contacts/search`* the docs aren't clear what the parameter in the request body `after` means. Is this the offset of results to look through? It's confusing as the example response includes a json object for `paging` with an `after` that is a string of random characters and a query to add to the url.

Do I need to add the query to the url to get the next set of results?
Is the returned `after` what I should be using for subsequent requests to get all contacts?
Are the array of `properties` in the request the properties to return in the contacts in the response?
Is there anyway to get all the details/properties of an `Owner`? Doesn’t seem like the properties endpoint supports Owners?
it should give you all the properties<https://developers.HubSpot.com/docs/api/crm/owners>

Hello, Is it possible to increase the limit for `filters` and `filterGroups`
I got error
